chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn A Berg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with minors
No contact with the victim and the family
Participation and completion of Sex Offender Treatment
Participation and completion of AODA treatment
Participation and completion of any other counseling deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the agent.
Register and maintain compliance with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry.
Provide  information to allow prison social worker to remove victims picture from Facebook account.
State has 60 days to file a request for restitution

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn A Berg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shawn A Berg in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Shawn A Berg in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All parties have received the PSI and the independent evaluation and are prepared to proceed today.
Heath Rush reads statement to the Court. 
Atty Hendee makes sentencing arguments and recommends 15 years initial confinement, followed by 15 years Extended Supervision with conditions as listed in the PSI along with other conditions. Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments and recommends 4 years initial confinement, followed by 6 years extended supervision.
Defendant makes statement to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Court sentences defendant to 30 years in the Wisconsin Prison System.  Court orders 15 years initial confinement, followed by 15 years Extended Supervision.  Granted 329 days credit.
Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Conditions of Extended Supervision include:
*Pay court costs of $268.00.
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00.
*Payment of Court obligations and supervision fees.
*No contact with minors.
*No contact with the victim and the family.
*Participation and completion of Sex Offender Treatment.
*Participation and completion of AODA treatment.
*Participation and completion of any other counseling deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the agent.
*Register and maintain compliance with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry.
*State has 60 days to file request for restitution.
*Provide information (password) to allow prison or social worker to remove victims picture from his Facebook account.

If there is an objection to restitution, a hearing will be scheduled.

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
to Seal s/BNB/5-26-17
Evaluation Dr. Merrick Phd
Sentencing hearing on May 26, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Order to reset hearing
Sentencing hearing on May 3, 2017 at 10:15 am.
Letter to Court from Atty Gumz
Sentencing hearing on April 6, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Shawn A Berg in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the victim's mother is in the courtroom today.   Atty Hendee states that the victim's father was notified but with the roads he will not be here today.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Hendee states that the parties will be requesting a PSI.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.
PSI ordered.
bond continued  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Final pre-trial on December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on January 25, 2017 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Shawn A Berg in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Shawn A Berg in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee files the information.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Trial.
bond continued.

Clerk will schedule with counsel.
Bond Hearing 7/5/16, Reporter: Jill Bartol
Arraignment on September 8, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Shawn A Berg in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Shawn A Berg in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee asks for the statutory time to file the information. 

BY THE COURT:  Court gives time for the DA to file the information.
Set for Arraignment.
bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for September 8, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Atty Mark Gumz
Discovery Demand
Preliminary hearing on August 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shawn A Berg in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the time limits for the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver of time limits with his client.  

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; reset Prelim.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Statement of Compliance
Preliminary hearing on July 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shawn A Berg in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  

Court questions the defendant regarding time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant does not waive time limits.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits not waived; set for Preliminary Hearing within 10 days.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.
**Court ordered document sealed 7/20/16**
